moves.1. a4: I've never tried this opening before. I don't like the look of it. Please tell me what is.
moves.1... e5: I start my favorite opening which is the king's pawn opening.
moves.2. c4: He prevents me from getting my queens' pawn into the battle.
moves.2... Nc6: I always try to develop my pieces early.
moves.3. e4: Finally, he returned the king's pawn opening.
moves.4. d3: He frees his dark-square bishop, but traps the white.
moves.4... Bb4+: I will take advantage of the fact there is no pawn to stop me.
moves.5. Bd2: He blocks it with his bishop.
moves.6. Nxd2: He takes with his knight which is what I would've done.
moves.7. h4: I really don't know why he does that.
moves.8... Ng4: I try to get my knight more into the battle.
moves.9. h6: Now I think I see his plan. My guess is that The queen will somehow come down and try to checkmate  me protected by the rook.
moves.10. Be2: Maybe that bishop has something to do with the checkmate too.
moves.10... Bg4: I honestly don't know why I did that.
moves.11... Nd4: I try to make up for what I did. Now if I can just that queen out of the way I can fork his king and rook.
moves.12. Bf5: I really don't know what he is doing. Please comment.
moves.12... Nhxf5: I take it with my knight.
moves.13... h6: This is pretty much the only way to get out of checkmate.
moves.14... Nc2+: Now I get to do it.
moves.15. Kd1: He decides to move his king toward me.
moves.15... Nxa1: I got make up for my bad move.
moves.16. Ne4: Nows he is getting his knight into the battle.
moves.18... Qxd3+: There is no way out of this.
